page.title: 06Goldmire Quarry, Dalton
page.content: Goldmire Quarry is a limestone quarry which uses the rock to make bricks,concrete and tarmac.There are 19 workers and it is a very dangerous place beacause of the large machinery used and the explosions for blasting the rock away from the hillside.In order to extract the rock from the hillside several holes are drilled in the rock.The holes are filled with blasting jelly and diesel fuel.A cable connects each hole to a plunge box.When it is pushed it releases upto 10,000 tonnes of rock.The rocks are mostly limestone but there are pockets of clay and spar rock.The rock is broken up by machine and is transported from the quarry face to the plant area.There is a large variety of machines including one caterpillar 966D loader,and a Terex Dumper.All the rock is put in the
